file_content.text: You've achieved more than I could ever imagine.
Darth Decimus chose his allies well.
Follow me, and you'll swim in the spoils of war. But first, we destroy the rebellion. We must decorate Corellia with their dead.
Take a rocket tram to the ruins of Labor Valley. Help Major Tradik burn the rebels out of hiding. Then we will speak again.
Beautiful work. The CEC directors' deaths shook the rebellion. We'll ensure their new leadership is more sympathetic to our cause.
Outstanding job. The CEC surrender shook the rebellion. We'll mold their board into icons of Imperial loyalty.
My master wishes to express his gratitude.
I am Darth Decimus, member of the Dark Council, architect of Corellia's invasion.
Darth Baras is right to hate one so powerful. Such strength... it fills the air around you.
From slavery rises the most powerful Sith in generations. Darth Thanaton is right to fear you.
I understand you're unraveling a conspiracy. How fortunate that it brought you here.
I've been watching you, victor of the Great Hunt, champion of the Blacklist. How fortunate that your latest prey brought you here.
You will be the executor of the Empire's victory. It is your destiny.
Power attracts power. How fortunate that you've all gathered here, at the moment of the Empire's greatest fight.
Corellia is filled with wretched people... crude, scheming animals, begging to be conquered. We can help them by winning this battle. But I require your help.
As you wish.
Loyalty deserves compensation. Darth Charnus...?
That's a lot of pressure.
Consider this an investment in your potential....
My help will cost you.
Charity is for the weak and the lazy. The Empire is neither. You'll be well-rewarded.
The CEC ion cannons are offline; the rocket trams can run again!
We must celebrate--come to the Tears of Taris at once.
Good, you made it. The explosives team is standing by with the hull-cracker. But that's not all.
A defector inside CEC has contacted us. Claims he has useful information, but he'll only talk to you.
Benton Maas, say hello to the Sith who's about to destroy your pathetic company.
Benton Maas, meet our top agent on Corellia.
Benton Maas, hunter. Hunter, Benton Maas.
Benton Maas, say hello to your company's worst nightmare.
Benton Maas, meet the crew who's about to dismantle your precious company.
It's an honor, my lord. I'm the only one here who respects your power.
Bow before me. Pledge your support to the Empire's occupation.
Prove your respect.
As you wish, my lord. Imperial rule is just what this corrupt, Republic-riddled world needs.
All I want from you is terror, despair and devotion.
I don't need your respect.
Your power is beyond comprehension, my lord. That's why I wish to serve you.
Just the operative I wanted to see! I must talk with someone who's used to handling sensitive information.
Discretion is one of my many specialties. What's on your mind?
You're wise to contact me.
I hear you're the top merc on Corellia. These Imperials don't understand, but I can level with a pro like you.
It takes a pro like me to tear down your little company.
You're right to respect me.
I've heard as much. Your work's already left a deep wound on this planet.
Thank you! I need to speak with someone I can respect. Someone with your... unique skill set.
A holocall won't protect you from my power. Explain yourself, quickly.
I will handle this.
Don't shy away from true power. If you want something, address me.
What's wrong? Afraid of me?
We traced your frequency. Start talking, or I'll track you down.
Let me handle this.
Cut the bootlicking and start talking.
I'll handle this.
Your company's doomed. Trying to jump ship?
Are you calling to surrender?
That's right. I'm too old to be on the losing side.
Wow me.
You've got the hull-cracker. CEC can't defend against that. But I can make your fight a bit easier... all I'm asking for is mercy.
There's a back entrance through the manufacturing wing. Get close, and I'll open it for you.
We already have Czerka's hull-cracker. We don't need a back door.
An explosion'll bring our security forces running. But slip through the manufacturing wing and you'll catch CEC by surprise.
The Force more than compensates for a noisy entrance.
Sith don't need surprise.
We'll consider your proposal, Benton Maas. Once CEC falls to the Empire, we will repay your loyalty.
A clean infiltration will assure our victory.
Surprise could prove useful.
They'll still be waiting for the blast when you sneak right past them.
The fewer guards that see me, the quicker I reach my target.
Surprise could prove useful.
They won't realize you're coming 'til your blaster's in their face.
Good work. I'll take your proposal under advisement.
Thanks for the tip.
Follow my advice, and CEC will fall. Just spare my life.
Spare me the amateur strategy.
Please--I just listened to a security briefing. Those hangars are CEC's vulnerable area.
I better go before the directors come looking for me. Remember, the manufacturing wing's your best shot. And long live the Emperor!
Idiot. Still, his information may prove useful.
Infiltrating the hangars could avoid most security. Czerka's hull-cracker is more direct, if bloodier. I doubt our demolition crew will survive the detonation.
I don't care about casualties. We're blasting our way in.
Stick with the hull-cracker.
Excellent. I'll contact the explosives team at once.
These men are the most proficient engineers this side of the blockade.
Never met a bomb we couldn't handle. Watch our backs, and we'll bust CEC's shell for you.
Then deal with their board of directors and disable the ion cannons. Once the rocket trams are operational, our invasion is back on track.
Safety first. I'll try the hangar entrance.
I prefer a cautious approach.
CEC has held us hostage too long.
The CEC droids are in disarray. Find Commander Krade while we have the upper hand.
Confuse the CEC droids. Then we'll shatter their defenses.
With the hull-cracker in our possession, we can finally shut down CEC and end their attacks on our rocket trams.
But first we must deal with their army. Legions of battle droids defend the CEC fortress. Our explosives team can't get close enough to detonate the hull-cracker.
CEC commands them somehow. Cut the droids off, and they lose control.
Can we disable them?
You're right. CEC uses signal towers to direct their army. It's their only weak point.
CEC's army will fall before my lightsaber.
I'll cut them down.
I'll melt those CEC rust buckets into a pile of steaming circuits.
I can fry CEC's army.
We'd need a battalion of Sith, all as powerful as you, to put a dent in their numbers. There's only one other solution.
Every droid model has exploitable weaknesses.
I'll eliminate them.
Hmm, a good point.
When the smoke clears, you'll need a microscope to find the droids' remains.
I'll disintegrate them.
The most devastating weapons couldn't wipe out the CEC reserves. There's only one solution.
A few scrap-piles with blasters won't save them.
Droids? Is that all?
CEC's private peacekeeping force is powerful. But they have a weakness....
These droids take orders directly from CEC. Signal towers transmit commands, and they obey with deadly precision.
Bringing down the signal towers will disrupt the droids. Our explosives team sneaks in, detonates the hull-cracker, and blows the CEC doors wide open.
CEC is about to lose contact with their army.
I'll raze the towers.
If your army pitches in, we can wipe out every last tower.
Don't I get any backup?
The CEC defenses are designed to deflect a large-scale attack. I can't sacrifice my men... yet.
Fine. But I won't enjoy it.
The excitement comes when we topple CEC. This is simply an overture.
Once you remove the signal towers, contact Commander Krade in CEC territory. He'll prepare you for our final assault.
Here are the detonation codes. Brall Tavar was eager to hand them over.
I'm sure he was. Thanks to you, the Czerka Corellia hull-cracker is ours. These codes will awaken its power.
Commander Jastal briefed me on your handling of the Brall Tavar situation. His untimely end certainly broke Czerka's resistance.
Brall Tavar's punishment will scare every rebel on Corellia.
His death was a warning.
If you want to really break the rebels' spirits, help me close Corellian Engineering Corporation.
Tavar didn't stand a chance.
Don't get too confident. Czerka was insignificant next to Corellian Engineering Corporation.
Plus, due to your quick thinking with Brall Tavar, Czerka's learned to appreciate Imperial dominance.
The insurgents expect us to be violent. Show benevolence, and they'll forget what they're fighting.
Mercy will win over rebels.
Compassion has no place in war. Remember that when you call on our friends at Corellian Engineering Corporation.
No one can resist my methods.
You may have lured Czerka in, but Corellian Engineering Corporation won't be so easily convinced.
Enough about Czerka.
Your talents are needed on the ground to dismantle Czerka's defenses and liberate their hull-cracker.
We can't coordinate Czerka's downfall from up here. Speak with Commander Jastal in the field.
Teach Czerka Corellia some manners.
Coronet City. The jewel of Corellia. Home to the finest trading and ship manufacturing in Republic space.
Soon this will all belong to the Empire--and the rest of the galaxy will follow.
Where are my manners? I am Darth Charnus, agent to the Dark Council. My master--Darth Decimus--requested your assistance.
He says only the most powerful Sith can help us win Corellia.
I will show this planet the Force's true might.
None are more powerful.
Pity you weren't here to set an example during our initial assault.
He believes only the Empire's most lethal agent can help us win Corellia.
I can deliver this planet. Just tell me how many fatalities are too many.
That would be me.
Ha! Your expertise would have proven invaluable in our initial assault.
He claims only the galaxy's most notorious bounty hunter can help us take Corellia.
I'll show this planet how I earned my reputation.
That's me, all right.
We could have used your blasters during the initial assault.
He senses your greatness. Only one with your skill can take Corellia for the Empire.
Search the galaxy for someone who can match my strength. You'll find no one.
None are more skilled than me.
I'm sure. We certainly could have used your lightsaber during our initial assault.
Ignoring my strength with the Force would be unwise.
Don't overlook my power.
I wouldn't dream of it. We could have used your skill with the dark side during our initial assault.
Defeating a planet requires a deft touch.
Sometimes you need subtlety.
I don't doubt your skills. We could have used them during our initial assault.
Think I'm not strong enough? Tell it to all the bodies I've piled up.
Uh, I'm standing right here.
I know your reputation, hunter. If only you'd been here during our initial assault.
Tell me more about Corellia.
This planet was ripe for conquering. Darth Decimus plotted our assault, and we moved in.
Corellia? Who cares.
The galactic war's outcome will be decided here. You wouldn't be so carefree if you'd witnessed our initial assault.
The invasion was magnificent, our occupation flawless. Imperial forces filled Corellia's high-speed rocket trams. We began to cover Coronet City.
Then rebellion erupted. Unruly Corellians knocked out the rocket trams. Now our soldiers are stranded.
Send your troops against the rebels. Don't give them an inch.
Fight back.
Our men are barely equipped to hold the spaceport. We need you to go after the insurgents behind the attacks.
Air-drop your men, send in shuttles. Anything to keep troops on the streets.
Get different transportation.
Alternate methods risk being shot down, plus they're unpredictable. I'm afraid our occupation's crippled without the high-speed rails.
And we still haven't attacked?
We're preparing to strike the rebels responsible for these heinous assaults.
The guilty party is Corellian Engineering Corporation. The oldest ship manufacturer in Republic history.
CEC exploited our one weakness. They turned their ion cannons on all outgoing trams, freezing our invasion, trapping us on the doorstep of the Empire's greatest battle.
Storm the company, and shut them down. It's the only way we'll break their blockade.
Take CEC over.
I agree completely. Unfortunately, CEC's shielded against conventional attacks. There's only one way in.
Destroy all guns firing on the rocket trams. Problem solved.
Knock out their ion cannons.
We've tried, but their emplacements are heavily shielded and must be shut down from inside CEC. There's only one way to breach their walls.
We can't catch a break.
Worse, their ion cannons can only be disabled from inside CEC. They're shielded against all weapons... except one.
The hull-cracker--a compact bomb, developed by Czerka Corellia's deviant scientists to punch holes through capital ships. It will get us inside CEC.
Then we disable their ion cannons, resume rocket tram traffic and conquer Corellia. Unfortunately, Czerka's joined the rebellion--they refuse to hand over their hull-cracker.
Czerka will cooperate with the Empire or be destroyed.
Then I'll take it.
Some broken fingers should loosen their grip on this weapon.
I'll teach Czerka to share.
They'll support the Empire. They just need the proper encouragement.
I'll pay Czerka a visit.
If Czerka won't give their weapon up, I'll take it.
I don't need permission.
Show them your arsenal, and they may even wrap up the hull-cracker with a bow.
I've got other business. Still, stealing Czerka's weapon is tempting.
Maybe I could deal with them.
Consider it. You're trapped here as long as the rocket trams are down.
I may help, but not for free.
You'll be performing a service for Darth Decimus himself. It's safe to assume you'll be compensated.
The hull-cracker's under constant guard. Destroy Czerka's assault camps, and they'll abandon the weapon to reinforce their headquarters.
Once you rout the camps, find our Commander Jastal in Czerka territory. Then we'll liberate that hull-cracker.
Too bad. [Refuse quest]
Darth Decimus will be most disappointed.
This is a CEC deployment beacon, designed to call their battle droid reinforcements. I suspect you'll find a use for it.
Our attack is prepared, Darth Charnus.
Storm CEC, then contact me from their security holoterminal. Once you're in position, we'll strike at their heart.
